chefBio: A renowned Italian restaurateur and chef who is the owner of Osteria Francescana, a three-Michelin-star restaurant located in Modena, Italy. He is known for his contemporary take on traditional Italian cuisine.

recipies.name: Tagliatelle with Hand-Chopped Ragù
recipies.method: Brown finely chopped beef chuck in a large pot with olive oil.Add finely chopped onion, carrot, celery, and minced garlic and sauté until vegetables are softened. Pour in canned chopped tomatoes and beef stock and bringredients to a simmer. Reduce heat and let ragù cook for 2 hours, stirringredients occasionally. Cook tagliatelle pasta in salted boilingredients water until al dente. Drain pasta and add it to pot with ragù. Toss pasta with ragù until well coated with sauce. Serve.

recipies.name: Risotto Cacio e Pepe
recipies.method: In a large pot or saucepan, sauté the onion in a little olive oil until softened. Add the rice to the pot and stir for a minute until coated with the oil and onion mixture. Pour in a ladleful of hot stock and stir gently until the liquid is absorbed. Continue addingredients the stock gradually, stirringredients frequently until the rice is cooked, but still slightly firm to the bite (this should take about 18-20 minutes). Remove the pot from the heat and add the grated Pecorino Romano cheese and butter. Stir vigorously until the cheese and butter are melted and well combined. Add a generous amount of freshly ground black pepper and a pinch of salt to taste.

chefBio: A pioneeringredients Italian chef who is widely considered as the founder of modern Italian cuisine. He was the first Italian chef to be awarded three Michelin stars and was known for his innovative approach to cookingredients.
